title: May be personal representative, guardian, trustee, or other fiduciary
context: §572-26 May be personal representative, guardian, trustee, or other fiduciary. A married person may be a personal representative, guardian, trustee, custodian, or other fiduciary and may bind the person&rsquo;s self and the estate the person represents without any act or assent on the part of the person&rsquo;s spouse. [L 1888, c 11, §4; RL 1925, §2996; RL 1935, §4647; RL 1945, §12368; RL 1955, §325-3; HRS §573-3; am L 1976, c 200, pt of §1; ren and am L 1987, c 46, pt of §2]
